page.title: 07THE BUCHAN OBSERVER
page.content: The Buchan Observer was founded in 1863 by John McArthur & Sir Hugh Reid (editor)It now has been going strong for 122 years.At first it came out twice weekly Tuesday & Friday.Then they changed it to Tuesday only.They now make roughly just under 9000 copies a week & all of them are sold. If you look at a copy of "Buchan Observer" you will see the words "Veritas Vincit"which is Latin for "Truth Succeeds". The office & printing works where the paper is made is situated in 17 Chapel Street. The "Buchan Observer" has always been a local newspaper & the purpose of it is to advertise & tell us the local news.
